dk.pervasive.jcaf
Class Context

java.lang.Object
  dk.pervasive.jcaf.Context
All Implemented Interfaces:
XMLSerializable, java.io.Serializable
public class Context
extends java.lang.Object
implements XMLSerializable

The Context class represents a simple context for an Entity, which contains various types of ContextItem.

All context information is encapsulated in this Context object, which is serializable. Hence, if you remotely receive a context object, then you will not be able to add context items to this context using the addContextItem() method. If you need to add context items to an entity, use the addContextItem() method on the ContextService interface.

This class is rather generic, and can be subclassed in order to create specific context behavior in specific usage settings, like a hospital or an office.

Author:
Jakob Bardram
See Also:
ContextItem, ContextService, Serialized Form

contains

public boolean contains(ContextItem item)
Tests if some relationship maps into the specified item in this Context. This operation is more expensive than the containsRelationship method.

Parameters:
item - - an item to search for.
Returns:
true if and only if some relationship maps to the item argument in this context as determined by the equals method; false otherwise.

Returns:
